√yaj 'offer'

present: [1.] yájati  yájate etc. V.+   -- [2.] yákṣi  yákṣva   -- yajase (1s.)  

perfect: iyāja etc. E.+  ījé etc. V.+  yejé  

aorist: [1.] ijyāt   -- [3.] ayīyajat etc.   -- [4.] ayākṣīt etc.  ayās  ayāṭ  yákṣat  yakṣatas  yakṣatām  ayaṣṭa etc.  yakṣate etc.  yakṣīya  

future: [1.] yakṣyati etc. B.+  yakṣyati etc. V.+   -- [2.] yaṣṭā́  

verbal: iṣṭá V.+  yáṣṭum B.+  yáṣṭave  ījitum  iṣṭvā́ AV.+  -ijya  jájadhyai  yajádhyai  -yā́jam  

secondary: passive: ijyate etc. E.+  ijyant   -- intensive: yāyaj-   -- desiderative: yiyakṣati  yiyakṣate  íyakṣati etc.  íyakṣate etc.   -- causative: yājayati etc. B.+  yājayate  

derivatives: -ij V.+  yaj V.+  yāj V.+  yája B.  yajā S.  yajin B.+  -yájya RV.  -yajyā V.B.S.  ijya C.  ijyā S.+  yájana AV.+  yajás RV.  -yaji RV.  yájus V.+  yajatá V.  íṣṭi V.+  yajati S.+  yaṣṭavyà B.+  yaṣṭṛ V.+  yájatra V.B.  yajátha V.  yajñá V.+  yájyu V.  yájīyas V.  yájiṣṭha V.  yájvan V.+  yajvin E.+  yajiṣṇu E.  -yāga E.+  -yāja V.+  yājaka E.+  -yājin B.+  yājya B.+  yājyā̀ B.+  yājana S.+  yājanīya C.  -yā́juka B.  yāyajū́ka B.+  yiyakṣu E.+  yājayitavyà B.  yājayitṛ C.  

Appears to be related with roots yam and yach and yat, and to mean originally 'reach out, extend'.
